items.content_html:
This PR updates the statement comparison lib to improve statement order. The statement comparison now performs the following:

  • Statements with version_removed are compared against each other in reverse chronological order, regardless of other factors
    • If both statements have the same version_removed, other factors like prefixes and partial support will be considered
  • Statements with partial implementation are now sorted underneath features with prefixes/alt. names, as it was intended to be
items.title: Update statement comparison for better readability and fixed sorting

items.content_html:
• related to mdn/content#29849

The PR adds new sizing values specs to the size properties.
items.title: fix(css): add 'fit-content' value spec to size properties

items.title: Firefox 119 release

items.content_html:
The output of the update-browser-releases script is:

@mdn/browser-compat-data@5.3.26 update-browser-releases
node --loader=ts-node/esm --no-warnings=ExperimentalWarning scripts/update-browser-releases/index.ts --all

Updates for Chrome for Desktop

  • New release notes for chrome 118: https://chromereleases.googleblog.com/2023/10/stable-channel-update-for-desktop_10.html, previously undefined

Updates for Chrome for Android

  • New status for chrome_android 118: current, previously nightly
  • New release notes for chrome_android 118: https://chromereleases.googleblog.com/2023/10/chrome-for-android-update.html, previously undefined
  • New status for chrome_android 119: beta, previously planned
  • New release date for chrome_android 119: 2023-10-31, previously undefined
  • New release detected for chrome_android: Version 120 as a nightly release.
  • New status for chrome_android 116: retired, previously current
  • New status for chrome_android 117: retired, previously beta
  • New release detected for chrome_android: Version 121 as a planned release.

  • New release notes for webview_android 118: https://chromereleases.googleblog.com/2023/10/chrome-for-android-update.html, previously undefined
  • New release detected for webview_android: Version 119 as a beta release.
  • New release detected for webview_android: Version 120 as a nightly release.
  • New status for webview_android 116: retired, previously current
  • New status for webview_android 117: retired, previously beta
  • New release detected for webview_android: Version 121 as a planned release.

Updates for Edge for Desktop

  • New release date for edge 118: 2023-10-24, previously 2023-10-13
  • New release notes for edge 118: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/deployedge/microsoft-edge-relnote-stable-channel#version-1180208869-october-24-2023, previously https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/deployedge/microsoft-edge-relnote-stable-channel#version-1180208846-october-13-2023
  • New status for edge 119: nightly, previously beta
  • New status for edge 120: planned, previously nightly

Updates for Firefox for Desktop

  • New status for firefox 119: current, previously beta
  • New status for firefox 120: beta, previously nightly
  • New status for firefox 121: nightly, previously planned
  • New status for firefox 118: retired, previously current
  • New release detected for firefox: Version 122 as a planned release.

Updates for Firefox for Android

  • New status for firefox_android 119: current, previously beta
  • New status for firefox_android 120: beta, previously nightly
  • New status for firefox_android 121: nightly, previously planned
  • New status for firefox_android 115: esr, previously retired
  • New status for firefox_android 118: retired, previously current
  • New release detected for firefox_android: Version 122 as a planned release.
items.title: Update browser releases

items.content_html:
I've run the collector for Firefox 120 beta.

This PR sets the following features to 120:

User activation (confirmed by https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1791079)

  • api.Navigator.userActivation
  • api.UserActivation
  • api.UserActivation.hasBeenActive
  • api.UserActivation.isActive

ToggleEvent (confirmed by https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1817122) (Not in Ruth's list!)

  • api.ToggleEvent
  • api.ToggleEvent.ToggleEvent
  • api.ToggleEvent.newState
  • api.ToggleEvent.oldState

WebAuthn addition (confirmed by https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1810851)

  • api.PublicKeyCredential.authenticatorAttachment

The following features are already marked as shipping in Firefox 120 in BCD:

  • css.types.color.light-dark
  • css.types.length.lh
  • css.types.length.rlh

The tracking issue Ruth filed contains a few more things that the collector doesn't know about.

More complex cases that need separate investigation:

  • html.iframe.lazy: This is nightly only and I guess it should be in Ruth's list as an experimental feature :)
  • <source media> for media elements: investigation needed where exactly we need to update compat data
  • moz-transform: investigation needed where exactly we need to update compat data

Cases I'm happy to just add to this PR if you want:

  • http.status.103: Added manually in de13a92
  • WebAuthn minPinLength extension: Need to add manually.
  • css.types.-moz-image-rect: Added manually in 6e065e2
  • css.properties.text-wrap.balance: need to add manually

cc @Rumyra @bsmth
items.title: Collector results for Firefox 120

items.content_html:
This draft PR is playing with the idea that compat features have groups. I'm experimenting with a few things here:

groups added to __compat

Adding a new optional property at the feature level called "groups". It's always an array.

 "groups": [
   "idle-detection",
   "interfaces"
],

Exporting a new groups tree

Adding a new "groups" export structure to the BCD build so you can see groups at a glance and which features belong to it. It currently is an array of objects with two properties "id" and "features". (Later it could have other properties, like minimum compatibility of all features in the group).

"groups": [
  {
    "features": [
      "api.AbortController",
      "api.IdleDetector"
    ],
    "id": "interfaces"
  },
  {
    "features": [
      "api.AbortController.AbortController",
      "api.IdleDetector.IdleDetector"
    ],
    "id": "constructors"
  },
  {
    "features": [
      "api.IdleDetector",
      "api.IdleDetector.IdleDetector",
      "api.IdleDetector.change_event",
      "api.IdleDetector.requestPermission_static",
      "api.IdleDetector.screenState",
      "api.IdleDetector.start",
      "api.IdleDetector.userState",
      "http.headers.Permissions-Policy.idle-detection"
    ],
    "id": "idle-detection"
  }
],

Contribution tools

View groups at contribution time

To view which features are part of which groups at contribution time, run the traverse script with a new group/g argument: npm run traverse -- -g idle-detection. This spits out:

api.IdleDetector
api.IdleDetector.IdleDetector
api.IdleDetector.change_event
api.IdleDetector.requestPermission_static
api.IdleDetector.screenState
api.IdleDetector.start
api.IdleDetector.userState
http.headers.Permissions-Policy.idle-detection
8

Applying groups to many features at once

Still to be done.

Group validation

Still to be done. Allow-list? Via web-features? Via a file in BCD?
items.title: (Experiment) Add groups to the schema

items.content_html:
This PR is a part of a project to add missing interfaces and interface features to BCD that are from an active spec (including WICG specs) and is supported in at least one browser. This particular PR adds the missing stroke-* CSS properties. The data comes from the mdn-bcd-collector project (v10.2.10).

Check out the collector's guide on how to review this PR.

Tests Used: https://mdn-bcd-collector.gooborg.com/tests/css/properties/stroke
items.title: Add missing stroke-* CSS property feature
